poem:
Title: "The Filmmaker's Flight"

In a world's whisper,
fleeing from the repressed,
Rasoulof, exiled voice,
paints Cannes with Iranian echoes.

His truth sown in film, 
a bitter seed nurtured,
in defiance of eight echoed years 
of concrete silence. 

Fear, vanishing like smoke
in the Cannes morning light -
an artful protest blooms,
against the backdrop of repression.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘Don’t be afraid’: exiled director Mohammad Rasoulof sends a message to Iranian cinema from Cannes The newly exiled Iranian director Mohammad Rasoulof, who fled his home country last month ahead of taking his new film to the Cannes festival, has spoken of drawing from his real life encounters with the repressive justice system in the Islamic Republic. Rasoulof, who fled Iran after receiving an eight-year prison sentence for making the film The Seed of the". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
